thread.title: North Carolina suspend cornerbacks for violating team rules
thread.title_full: North Carolina suspend cornerbacks for violating team rules

author: The Associated Press
title: North Carolina suspend cornerbacks for violating team rules
text: North Carolina suspend cornerbacks for violating team rules The Associated Press Print this article Advertisement CHAPEL HILL, N.C. — North Carolina cornerbacks M.J. Stewart and Mike Hughes have been suspended indefinitely for a violation of team rules, sidelining them for Saturday’s game against Wake Forest. In a release Thursday night, the school said Stewart and Hughes were suspended from team-related activities tied to an Oct. 4 incident in Chapel Hill. The release didn’t specify exactly what rule they had broken, though a statement from coach Larry Fedora referenced an “altercation” and that UNC has worked with Chapel Hill police to gather information.
